isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS, AND BUMPER - PROSTAR™ - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - BUMPER PANELS

step1.para: Unlatch and open the hood.
Release latches and lower the tilt-away bumper.
If equipped with fog lights, disconnect electrical connectors from fog lights.
Remove two pins and locknuts from two bumper hinge bolts ( Figure 2, Items 1, 2 and 3).
Slide two bumper hinge bolts out of two chassis hinge brackets far enough to clear the inside of the chassis hinge brackets ( Figure 2, Items 2 and 3).
Remove clevis pin from each clevis and disconnect two support cables ( Figure 3, Items 3, 4, and 5).
With the aid of an assistant, remove the tilt-away bumper from the chassis hinge brackets and position bumper on a solid work surface ( Figure 4, Items 1 and 2).
Remove six screws and bumper grille from tilt-away bumper.

note.para: If equipped with the chrome bumper, the support tube is secured to the bumper panel with an additional bolt that must be removed.

step1.para: Remove eight bolts from each side of bumper frame.
Remove bumper frame from the tilt-away bumper.
Remove nut, bolt, and support tube from tilt-away bumper. To remove the support tube from the bumper with chrome panels, remove two bolts and support tube from tilt-away bumper.
Remove nine screws from bumper panels.
Remove three nuts and bolts from the center of bumper panels.
Separate the two halves of the tilt-away bumper.
Carefully separate the inner panel from the outer panel.

note.para: If equipped with the chrome bumper panel perform steps 16 and 17.

step1.para: Remove the push pin fastener from the chrome bumper panel. If removing the right chrome bumper panel, two push pin fasteners will need to be removed.

caution.para: Exercise extreme care when removing the chrome bumper panel from the outer panel of the bumper. Use a scraper or puddy knife to work the panels apart, but avoid gouging, scratching, or breaking the panels during disassembly. Never use any form of heat to disassemble these panels, as the painted surface is not designed to withstand high heat. Failure to comply with these instructions will result in damage to these components.

step1.para: The chrome bumper panel is secured to the outer panel using two-sided tape. Carefully pull the chrome bumper panel loose from the outer panel.

note.para: If equipped with the chrome bumper panel perform steps 1 and 2.

step1.para: Install two-sided tape onto chrome bumper panel ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 2).

Position chrome bumper panel on the outer panel and install push pin fastener ( Figure 9, Items 2, 3, and 4). If installing the right chrome bumper panel, two push pin fasteners will need to be installed.
Insert the inner panel into the outer bumper panel ( Figure 8, Items 2 and 3).
Secure the outer panel to the inner panel with nine screws ( Figure 7, Items 2, 3, and 4). Torque bolts to 9 to 11 lbf-ft (12 to 15 N•m).
Align the two bumper halves together and secure with three bolts and nuts ( Figure 7, Item 1). Torque bolts to 8 to 10 lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).
Align bumper frame on tilt-away bumper and secure bumper frame with nine bolts ( Figure 6, Items 1 and 2). Torque bolts to 12 to 15 lbf-ft (16 to 20 N•m).

note.para: If equipped with the chrome bumper, the support tube is secured to the bumper panel with an additional bolt that must be installed.

step1.para: Secure the support tube to the bumper panels with a nut and bolt ( Figure 6). To install the support tube on the bumper with chrome panels, install two bolts and support tube on the tilt-away bumper. Torque bolts to 8 to 10 lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

Install two bumper hinge bolts into the bumper hinge brackets making sure that the bolt heads are on the outside of the hinge brackets and the ends of the bolts are not protruding through the hinge brackets ( Figure 4, Item 3).
With the aid of an assistant, install the tilt-away bumper on the chassis hinge brackets ( Figure 4, Items 1 and 2).
Slightly lift each side of the tilt-away bumper to slide the mount bolts completely through the chassis hinge brackets.
Connect two support cables to the tilt-away bumper with a clevis and clevis pin on each side ( Figure 3, Items 3, 4, and 5).
Install two mount nuts on two bumper hinge bolts ( Figure 2, Items 1 and 2). Torque bolts to 12 to 15 lbf-ft (16 to 20 N•m).
Install two pins through holes in two hinge bracket bolts ( Figure 2, Items 2 and 3).
If equipped with fog lights, connect electrical connector to fog lights.
Raise the tilt-away bumper and secure latches.
Close and latch the hood.
